Package main.java

Class Auth

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.Auth
  • class Auth
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that handles the authentication of the application, here the user is asked to enter his/her email and redirected to the logged In menu.
    Author:
    Eduardo Nunes

      • Auth

        public Auth​(java.util.Scanner sc,
            Products products,
            Date d,
            Promotions promotions)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor for the Auth class that initializes the customers Customers and prints the Authentication menu welcome(Scanner).
        Parameters:
        sc - Scanner object to read inputs
        products - Products object that contains all products in the database
        d - Date object that contains the current date
        promotions - Promotions object that contains all promotions in the database
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If we can't read/write to the files of our application

        private void welcome​(java.util.Scanner sc)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Method that welcomes the user and asks for login In this method the user is asked:
        • If the user wants to log in, login(Scanner)
        • If the user wants to exit

      • login

        private void login​(java.util.Scanner sc)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Method that asks for login.

        If the login was successful, creates a Logged In Object which contains the customer and date information

        Parameters:
        sc - Scanner object to read inputs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If we can't read our customers from file
